name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
description: Home to nearly half of the world's remaining mountain gorillas.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to February (Dry seasons)

name: Sipi Falls
description: A series of three stunning waterfalls on the foothills of Mt. Elgon.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, best in dry seasons (Dec-Feb, June-Aug)

name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
description: Known for its tree-climbing lions and diverse wildlife.
best_time_to_visit: January to February and June to July (Dry seasons)

name: Jinja (Source of the Nile)
description: Adventure capital of East Africa, source of the River Nile.

name: Murchison Falls National Park
description: Home to the powerful Murchison Falls and abundant wildlife.
best_time_to_visit: December to February (Best for game viewing)

name: Lake Bunyonyi
description: Serene lake with 29 islands, perfect for relaxation.

name: Kampala City
description: Vibrant capital city with rich history and modern amenities.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, avoid heavy rains in April/May

name: Mgahinga Gorilla National Park
description: Home to mountain gorillas and the Virunga Volcanoes.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to January

name: Kibale National Park
description: Primate capital of the world with 13 species of primates.
best_time_to_visit: December to February and June to July

name: Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary
description: Only place to see wild rhinos in Uganda.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, best tracking in dry mornings

name: Lake Mburo National Park
description: The smallest savannah national park, famous for zebras and impalas.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to February

name: Kidepo Valley National Park
description: Uganda's most isolated national park, offering true wilderness and rugged savannah landscapes.
best_time_to_visit: September to March (Dry season is best for game)

name: Rwenzori Mountains National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site featuring snow-capped peaks and unique alpine vegetation.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to February (Best for trekking)

name: Semuliki National Park
description: Famous for the Sempaya Hot Springs and being a birdwatcher's paradise.

name: Entebbe Town
description: A colonial town on the shores of Lake Victoria, home to the international airport and botanical gardens.

name: Ngamba Island Chimpanzee Sanctuary
description: A sanctuary on Lake Victoria dedicated to the care of orphaned chimpanzees.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, crossing depends on lake weather

name: Mabira Central Forest Reserve
description: One of Uganda's largest surviving natural forests, perfect for eco-tourism and adventure.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, drier months preferred for hiking

name: Mount Elgon National Park
description: An extinct shield volcano with the world's largest surface caldera.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to March

name: Ssese Islands
description: An archipelago of 84 islands in Lake Victoria, known for white sand beaches and sunsets.

name: Entebbe Zoo (UWEC)
description: Also known as Entebbe Zoo, a center for wildlife education and rescue.

name: Kasubi Tombs
description: The burial grounds for four Kabakas (Kings) of Buganda, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Namugongo Martyrs Shrine
description: A significant religious site commemorating the Uganda Martyrs.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, June 3rd is Martyrs Day (very crowded)

name: Fort Portal City
description: Known as the tourism city of Uganda, gateway to major national parks and crater lakes.

name: Toro-Semliki Wildlife Reserve
description: Uganda's oldest protected area, located between the Rwenzori mountains and Lake Albert.

name: Pian Upe Wildlife Reserve
description: One of the largest conservation areas, offering off-the-beaten-path wildlife experiences.

name: Bigodi Wetland Sanctuary
description: A community-run sanctuary famous for its rich biodiversity, especially primates and birds.

name: Budongo Forest
description: Part of the Murchison Falls conservation area, home to a large population of chimpanzees.
best_time_to_visit: December to February and June to August

name: Kalinzu Forest
description: A forest reserve near Queen Elizabeth NP, offering affordable chimp tracking.
best_time_to_visit: June to September and December to February

name: Kyambura Gorge
description: Known as the 'Valley of Apes', a stunning underground forest in Queen Elizabeth NP.
best_time_to_visit: June to August and December to February

name: Ishasha Sector (QENP)
description: Famous for its unique tree-climbing lions.
best_time_to_visit: June to September and January to February

name: Sezibwa Falls
description: A cultural heritage site with waterfalls, believed to have been born by a woman.

name: Aruu Falls
description: Cascading waterfalls in Pader district, a hidden gem for adventure lovers.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, best flow in rainy seasons

name: Nyero Rock Paintings
description: Ancient rock art sites dating back to the Iron Age.

name: Mount Moroto
description: A mountain in the Karamoja region offering challenging hikes and cultural encounters.

name: Uganda National Museum
description: The oldest museum in East Africa, showcasing Uganda's cultural heritage.

name: Ndere Cultural Centre
description: Home of the Ndere Troupe, offering spectacular traditional music and dance performances.

name: Bahai Temple
description: The only Bahá'í House of Worship on the African continent, set in beautiful gardens.

name: Gaddafi National Mosque
description: The largest mosque in Uganda, offering panoramic views of Kampala from its minaret.

name: Nakasero Market
description: Kampala's most famous market for fresh produce and local vibes.

name: Bulago Island
description: A private island resort on Lake Victoria, perfect for luxury escapes.

name: Tororo Rock
description: A massive rock formation defining the town of Tororo.

name: Itanda Falls
description: A powerful waterfall on the Nile, popular for extreme water sports.

name: Mpanga Forest Reserve
description: An accessible forest reserve near Kampala with impressive trees and birdlife.

name: Mabamba Swamp
description: One of the best places in the world to spot the elusive Shoebill Stork.

name: Ajai Wildlife Reserve
description: A wildlife reserve along the Albert Nile, historically a rhino sanctuary.

name: Kabaka's Lake
description: The largest man-made lake in Uganda, created by Kabaka Mwanga II.

name: Rubaga Cathedral
description: The parent cathedral of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Kampala, located on Rubaga Hill.

name: Namirembe Cathedral
description: The oldest cathedral in Uganda, offering history and great views of Kampala.

name: Lake Mutanda
description: A stunning volcanic lake with island-dotted waters and mountain backdrops.
